info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 3:36AM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A WINTRY MIX OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... A strong cold front will move into the Western Low Rolling Plains today, and through the rest of West Texas and Southeast New Mexico tonight. Freezing drizzle will be possible behind the front after midnight tonight, mainly over the Western Low Rolling Plains, as well as the northern and central Permian Basin. This may mix with sleet Wednesday night and Thursday morning as an upper level disturbance arrives over the region. At this time, ice accumulations are expected to be light...under a tenth of an inch...and mainly on elevated surfaces, bridges, and overpasses. Motorists should exercise caution by slowing down and increasing following distances.
